data.title: 2024 film and high-end TV productions shooting in the UK and Ireland: latest updates
data.meta_description: A snapshot of the film and high-end TV projects shooting in the UK and Ireland.
data.text:
Screen reveals a snapshot of the latest high-end TV and film productions shooting in the UK for the big studios and streamers.

Please contact us here to add or update changes to the following or new productions taking place in the UK.

Films

All Five Eyes

A family drama surrounding three sisters with different outlooks on life.

Dir: Jaclyn Bethany

Prod: Sulk Youth Films, BKE Productions

Where: Kent

When: Aug - ongoing

Distributor: TBC

Cast: Honor Swinton Byrne, Sophie Kauer, Greta Bellamacina

Madfabulous

Tells the story of Henry Paget, fifth Marquess of Angelsey, who rejected traditional values to lead an extravagant lifestyle.

Dir: Celyn Jones

Prod: Mad As Birds Films

Where: Wales

When: Aug - ongoing

Distributor: TBC

Cast: Callum Scott Howells, Rupert Everett, Ruby Stokes

The Last Disturbance Of Madeline Hynde Contemporary psychological thriller. Plot under wraps.

Dir: Kenneth Branagh

Prod: Maximum Effort

Where: UK

When: Aug - ongoing

Distributor: TBC

Cast: Jodie Comer

In The Shadows

A biopic surrounding the first Somali-British professional boxing champion, Ramala Ali.

Dir: Anthony Wonke

Prod: Sleeper Films, Affine Films

Where: London

When: Aug - ongoing

Distributor: True Brit Entertainment

Cast: Jasmine Jobson, Finn Cole, Gershwyn Eustache Jr

The Fantastic Four: First Steps

Dir: Matt Shakman

Prod: Disney

Where: Pinewood Studios

When: Aug - ongoing

Distributor: Disney

Cast: Pedro Pascal, Vanessa Kirby, Joseph Quinn, Ebon Moss-Bachrach

Hamnet

An adaptation of Maggie O’Farrell’s novel surrounding Shakespeare’s family life.

Dir: Chloe Zhao

Prod: Hera Pictures, Neal Street Productions, Amblin Entertainment

Where: Wales

When: July - ongoing

Distributor: TBC

Cast: Jessie Buckley, Paul Mescal

After The Hunt

A university professor is conflicted when a student raises accusations against her colleague.

Dir: Luca Guadagnino

Prod: Imagine Entertainment, Frenesy

Where: London

When: July - ongoing

Distributor: Amazon MGM Studios

Cast: Julia Roberts, Andrew Garfield, Ayo Edebiri

PIllion

A shy young man enters into a submissive relationship with the older leader of a motorbike gang.

Dir: Harry Lighton

Prod: Element Pictures

Where: South/south-east

When: July - Sep

Distributor: September Film

Cast: Harry Melling, Alexander Skarsgard

Bugonia

A remake of the 2003 South Korean sci-fi comedy Save The Green Planet!

Dir: Yorgos Lanthimos

Prod: Element Pictures, Square Peg, Fruit Tree

Where: Wycombe

When: July - ongoing

Distributor: Universal

Cast: Emma Stone, Jesse Plemons

Finnegan’s Foursome

Two brothers and their sons travel to Ireland for an annual gold tournament.

Dir: Edward Burns

Prod: Wild Atlantic Pictures

Where: Dublin, Wicklow

When: July - ongoing

Distributor: N/A

Cast: N/A

Touché

A comedy-drama about the world of fencing.

Dir: Parvinder Shergill, Leif Johnson

Prod: Pinder Production, Raspberry Films

Where: Berkshire, west London

When: July - ongoing

Distributor: N/A

Cast: Matthew Lewis, Parvinder Shergill, Nina Wadia

Fuze

A heist takes place after London is evacuated following the discovery of an unexploded WWII bomb.

Dir: David Mackenzie

Prod: Sigma Films

Where: London

When: July - ongoing

Distributor: Sky Cinema,

Cast: Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Theo James, Sam Worthington, Gugu Mbatha-Raw

Blue Moon

A biopic about the dying days of Lorenz Hart.

Dir: Richard Linklater

Prod: Detour/Renovo

Where: Dublin

When: July - ongoing

Distributor: Sony

Cast: Andrew Scott, Margaret Qualley, Bobby Cannavale

Mr Burton

A biopic surrounding actor Richard Burton and the influence of his schoolteacher.

Dir: Marc Evans

Prod: Severn Screen, Promise Pictures

Where: UK

When: July - ongoing

Distributor: Independent Entertainment (sales)

Cast: Harry Lawtey, Toby Jones, Lesley Manville

The Thursday Murder Club

Adaptation of Richard Osman’s novel about four pensioners who solve crimes in their retirement home.

Dir: Chris Columbus

Prod: Amblin Entertainment

Where: UK

When: June - ongoing

Distributor: Netflix

Cast: Helen Mirren, Pierce Brosnan, Ben Kingsley

The Magic Faraway Tree

Film adaptation of Enid Blyton’s children’s book about two parents who move to the countryside and discover a tree.

Dir: Ben Gregor

Prod: Neal Street Productions, Elysian Film Group

Where: Shenfield

When: June - Sep

Distributor: Pallisade Park Pictures (sales)

Cast: Andrew Garfield, Claire Foy, Nicola Coughlan

Jurassic World 4

The fourth instalment in the Jurassic Park spin-off franchise.

Dir: Gareth Edwards

Prod: Amblin Entertainment, Universal Pictures

Where: Sky Studios Elstree

When: June - ongoing

Distributor: Universal

Cast: Scarlett Johansson, Jonathan Bailey, Mahershala Ali

Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery The third feature following private investigator Benoit Blanc.

Dir: Rian Johnson

Prod: T-Street Pictures

Where: South, South East UK

When: June - ongoing

Distributor: Netflix

Cast: Daniel Craig, Josh O’Connor, Mila Kunis

Wasteman

Prison thriller.

Dir: Calum Macdiarmid

Prod: Sophia Gibber, Myles Payne

Where: London and Somerset

When: June

Distributor: Lionsgate (UK), Bankside Films (Sales)

Cast: David Jonsson, Tom Blyth

Downton Abbey 3

The third film spinning of from the TV series picks up in the late 1920s. Dir: Simon Curtis Prod: Carnival Films, Focus Features Where: The Story Works, LondonWhen: May-ongoing Distributor: Focus Features Cast: Paul Giamatti, Joely Richardson, Hugh Bonneville, Elizabeth McGovern, Michelle Dockery

Dream Space

Centres around mental health and homelessness.

Dir: Harris Dickinson

Prod: Devisio Pictures

Where: East London

When: June - ongoing

Distributor: N/A

Cast: N/A

Project Hail Mary

Adaptation of Andy Weir’s sci-fi novel of the same name.

Dir: Phil Lord, Christopher Miller

Prod: Amazon MGM Studios

Where: London, UK

When: June

Distributor: Amazon MGM studios

Cast: Ryan Gosling, Sandra Huller

Power Ballad

A musical comedy about a wedding singer and a rock story.

Dir: John Carney

Prod: 30West, Likely Story

Where: Dublin, Ireland

When: May - ongoing

Distributor: 30West, WME/UTA (sales)

Cast: Paul Rudd, Nick Jonas, Havana Rose Liu

Mission

A solitary man decides to embark on a journey of extreme experiences.

Dir: Paul Wright

Prod: Early Day Films, 65 Wilding Films

Where: Scotland

When: May - ongoing

Distributor: Blue Finch Films (sales)

Cast: George MacKay

Mission Impossible: Dead Reckoning Part Two

The eighth edition in the action franchise.

Dir: Christopher McQuarrie

Prod: Tom Cruise Productions

Where: London, Derbyshire

When: March - July 2023; March 2024 - ongoing

Ditsributor: Paramount

Cast: Tom Cruise, Hayley Atwell, Simon Pegg

TV

Adolescence (working title)

A family’s world is turned upside down when the 13-year-old son is charged with murder. A one-shot, real-time series directed by Philip Barantini.

Series creator: Stephen Graham, Jack Thorne

Prod: Warp Films, Matriarch Productions, Plan B

Where: UK

When: July - ongoing

Distributor: Netflix

Cast: Stephen Graham, Ashley Walters, Erin Doherty

House Of Guinness

Explores the beginnings of the infamous brewery dynasty.

Series creator: Steven Knight

Prod: Kudos

Where: Space Studios Manchester

When: July - December

Distributor: Netflix

Cast: Louise Partridge, Anthony Boyle, David Wilmot

Young Sherlock

A 19-year-old Sherlock Holmes solves his first case.

Series creator: Matthew Parkhill

Prod: Motive Pictures, Inspirational Entertainment

Where: UK

When: July - ongoing

Distributor: Prime Video

Cast: Hero Fiennes Tiffin, Natascha McElhone, Joseph Fiennes

How To Get To Heaven From Belfast

Three women’s lives are thrown into chaos when the fourth, estranged, member of their friendship group passes away.

Series creator: Lisa McGee

Prod: Hat Trick Productions

Where: Northern Ireland

When: July - ongoing

Distributor: Netflix

Cast: Roísín Gallagher, Sinéad Keenan, Caoilfhionn Dunne

The Girlfriend

A mother’s life spirals out of control in an effort to protect her son from his new girlfriend.

Dir: Robin Wright

Prod: Imaginarium Productions, Amazon MGM Studios

Where: London

When: June - ongoing

Distributor: Prime Video

Cast: Robin Wright, Olivia Cooke, Laurie Davidson

The Night Manager (series two)

The thriller picks up eight years after the first series.

Series director: Georgi Banks-Davies

Prod: The Ink Factory, Hangtime International Pictures

Where: London

When: June - ongoing

Distributor: BBC/Amazon

Cast: Tom Hiddleston, Olivia Colman, Camilla Monroe

The Seven Dials Mystery

An Agatha Christie adaptation surrounding a house party where a practical jokes goes murderously wrong.

Series creator: Chris Chibnall

Prod: Imaginary Friends Production, Orchid Pictures

Where: South West UK

When: June - ongoing

Distributor: Netflix

Cast: Mia McKenna-Bruce, Helena Bonham Carter, Martin Freeman

A Knight Of The Seven Kingdoms: The Hedge Knight

A Game Of Thrones prequel series.

Series directors: Owen Harris, Sarah Adina Smith

Prod: HBO

Where: Titanic Studios; Glenarm Castle, Belfast

When: June - ongoing

Distributor: HBO

Cast: Daniel Ings, Peter Claffey, Dexter Sol Ansell

Hijack(series two)

Thriller. Plot under wraps.

Series creator: Guy Bolton

Prod: Idiotlamp Productions Ltd, Green Door Pictures, 60Forty Films

Where: UK

When: June - ongoing

Distributor: AppleTV+

Cast: Idris Elba, Clare-Hope Ashitey, Karima McAdams

The Agency

Adaptation of French spy thriller about an undercover spy forced to return to normal life.

Series creator:

Prod: Smokehouse Pictures, MTV, 101 Studios

Where: Warner Bros Studios, Leavesden

When: June - ongoing

Distributor: Paramount+

Cast: Michael Fassbender, Richard Gere, Jeffrey Wright

Mix Tape

A four-part mini-series and love story adapted from a novel of the same name by Jane Sanderson, set between Sheffield and Australia.

Series creator: Lucy Gaffy

Prod: Foxtel Group, Aquarius Films, Subotica

Where: Dublin/Wicklow, Ireland

When: June 4 - July 4

Distributor: Binge

Cast: Teresa Palmer, Jim Sturgess

Wednesday (series two)

The second series in the Addams family spin-off about the titular Wednesday as a teenager.

Series creators: Al Gough, Miles Millar

Prod: MGM Television

Where: County Wicklow

When: May - ongoing

Distributor: Netflix

Cast: Jenna Ortega, Christina Ricci, Emma Myers

The Witcher

The fourth season of the medieval drama.

Series creator: Lauren Schmidt Hissrich

Prod: Platige Films, Hivemind Content

Where: Longcross Studios

When: April - ongoing

Distributor: Netflix

Cast: Liam Hemsworth, Freya Allan, Anya Chalotra

The Undertow

A woman’s life is turned upside down when her husband’s estranged identical twin brother returns.

Series director: Jeremy Lovering

Prod: Complete Fiction, wiip

Where: Scottish Highlands

When: April - ongoing

Distributor: Netflix

Cast: Jamie Dornan, Mackenzie Davis, Iain de Caestecker

Outlander (series eight)

The final series of the fantasy drama about a time-travelling nurse in the Jacobite rising.

Series creator: Ronald D. Moore

Prod: Left Bank Pictures, Sony Pictures Television, Tall Ship Productions

Where: Scotland

When: March - ongoing

Distributor: Starz

Cast: Caitríona Balfe, Sam Heughan

Slow Horses (series five and six)

The fifth season of the espionage spy thriller about a group of MI5 rejects.

Series creator: Will Smith

Prod: See-Saw Films

Where: London

When: February - ongoing

Distributor: AppleTV+

Cast: Gary Oldman, Jack Lowden, Kristen Scott Thomas

Andor (series two)

Prequel series to Star Wars’ Rogue One.

Series creator: Tony Gilroy

Prod: LucasFilm

Where: Pinewood Studios

When: November 2022 - July 2023, January 2024 - ongoing

Distributor: Disney+

Cast: Diego Luna, Stellan Skarsgård

The Sandman (series two)

The second series of the comic book adaptation about metaphysical entities.

Series creator: Neil Gaiman, David S. Goyer, Allan Heinberg

Prod: PurePop Inc, The Blank Corporation, Phantom Four, DC Entertainment, Warner Bros Television

Where: Pinewood Group, Shepperton

When: June - July, November 2023 - ongoing

Distributor: Netflix

Cast: Tom Sturridge, Patton Oswalt, Boyd Holbrook

This information comes from a variety of sources, including our sister site, Production Intelligence (PI), part of The Knowledge. For more details on PI and how to subscribe, click HERE for a demo

Additional reporting by Mona Tabbara, Emily Moss and Eliza Baskerville-McCrystal.
